text: Latinas had to work an extra 278 days to earn the same amount that white men did in 2022—making just 52 cents to the dollar. I’m proud to support @SenCortezMasto’s resolution to recognize October 5th as Latina Equal Pay Day and recommit to closing the racial and gender wage gaps.
Good. This announcement is an important step toward long-overdue relief for borrowers. Let's keep going until no one has to live under the crushing weight of student debt.

While the GOP peddles failed War on Drugs solutions that cost lives, this package of bills offers a real way forward: health care, housing, and making sure people have what they need to stay in recovery.

The Housing ACCESS Act will help connect people with health and housing services, and ensure providers have the bandwidth to serve every person who needs assistance. Secure housing is essential for health and recovery.

We need the Eliminating Opioid-Related Infectious Diseases Act to help the CDC and states address the public health impacts of the opioid epidemic—like the spread of HIV and Hep C—and connect people with high quality, compassionate care.
First, we need the SAFE in Recovery Act to prevent families from being separated, surveilled, or criminalized just because parents are getting the care they need.

October is Substance Misuse Prevention Month. To end this crisis, we must stop criminalizing people with substance use disorder and treat them with compassion. That’s why I’m introducing a legislative package to support Americans and their families as they navigate recovery.

Parents taking life-saving medications for substance use disorder live in fear of their family being separated—it's unacceptable. Supporting parents in recovery means supporting healthy families. That's why I'm introducing legislation to end this mandate. bostonglobe.com/2023/10/03/m…

Good. I’m glad @POTUS is taking this important step. Now, Congress must pass my GRACE Act to recommit the United States as a beacon of hope to those fleeing violence and persecution, and say loudly and clearly that refugees are welcome here. state.gov/the-presidential-d…

From the mound to the mic—Tim Wakefield inspired us all to be better teammates and better people. The ultimate Red Sox player, curse breaker, and World Series champion. My thoughts are with his family, friends, and all of New England as we mourn this tremendous loss.
markey.senate.gov/news/press…
My statement on the passing of Senator Dianne Feinstein.
We're live to introduce our Green New Deal for Public Schools. Let's build a green future where every student can learn and thrive. https://https://twitter.com/i/broadcasts/1rmxPMLyjvnKN

I’m calling on @Meta to halt its plan to integrate AI chatbots targeted at young people across its platforms. Time and time again, social media giants have chosen profits over privacy. We cannot allow Big Tech to use kids & teens as guinea pigs without regard for their wellbeing.

It’s plain and simple: all students deserve a school system that provides the full support they need to learn and thrive. The Cogswell-Macy Act will give deaf or hard of hearing, blind or low vision, deafblind, and deafdisabled students the tools to succeed in public schools.

Azerbaijan has spent months trying to starve out the Armenian population in Nagorno-Karabakh. Now, the military has launched an assault on the region that has worsened this crisis and sparked mass displacement. Unacceptable. We must hold the Azerbaijani government accountable.
markey.senate.gov/news/press…

Big Pharma was forced to return $50 billion of its ill-gotten opioid profits—now, those funds must be used for prevention and treatment. That's why @RepDavidTrone and I are urging @ONDCP to ensure these funds go to the communities most harmed by Big Pharma’s greed.
markey.senate.gov/news/press…

Since the Rehabilitation Act of 1973 was enacted, people with disabilities have had greater educational & employment opportunities, health care access, and more. My resolution honors this historic bill and our commitment to work towards full equality for people with disabilities.

Abortion is essential health care. And the organizers at @reproequity_now have been working for decades to ensure access in Massachusetts. I am so glad that they will now be expanding this important advocacy across New England as we build a regional block for abortion access.
markey.senate.gov/news/press…

I am so glad that Chairwoman Rosenworcel has heeded our calls and announced plans to reinstate net neutrality rules and reclassify broadband as an essential service. With a full slate of commissioners, the @FCC can take important action to ensure a just online future.
The public’s trust has been broken. Senator Menendez should resign.
markey.senate.gov/news/press…

Now that the FCC has a full slate of commissioners, we have the tools to ensure that the Internet is free and accessible. That’s why @RonWyden and I are urging the @FCC to restore its rightful authority over broadband regulation and reinstate net neutrality protections.
markey.senate.gov/news/press…

For too long, the FDA gave Big Pharma a pass and helped unleash the opioid epidemic. We can’t make that mistake again – it risks lives. Along with @Sen_JoeManchin, I’m urging @US_FDA to ensure they are taking the safest approach to evaluating opioid treatment for chronic pain.

As COVID-19 cases rise this fall, protect yourself and your loved ones. Sign up at covid.gov/tests to get 4 free COVID-19 rapid tests delivered to your door, and find a local provider for the updated booster at vaccines.gov/.
Wishing all those observing Yom Kippur a meaningful fast. G’mar Chatima Tova!

Congratulations, Maxwell. And congratulations to all the young activists who fought so hard for this victory. From the creation of a Climate Corps to the very first White House Office of Gun Violence Prevention, this week has made one thing clear—when young people fight they win.
Clarence Thomas must resign and Congress must pass a judicial code of ethics.

I applaud President Biden for heeding our call and making history today by establishing the White House’s Office of Gun Violence Prevention. We can and will end the epidemic of gun violence. We’re just getting started.

It's 10pm and I'm still thinking about the magic that I felt in front of the capitol today. From @AOC to the young people organizing with @sunrisemvmt to the countless advocates who fought so hard for a Climate Corps. Today, victory was ours. And tomorrow, we will keep fighting.
Today is a great day. Sign up at whitehouse.gov/ClimateCorps

I'm live with @RepAOC to celebrate @POTUS’s creation of a Climate Corps. The movement for a just and livable future is growing and we are building a world worth saving.
 https://https://twitter.com/i/broadcasts/1vAxRvaLzovxl
Thank you, @POTUS. And thank you to the movement for a just and livable future. Together we will build a better world.
Guess what JP? We did it. Thank you, @sunrisemvmt and the all-time, all-star team.
I couldn’t be more excited that President Biden is creating a Climate Corps. Thank you. Join us at 4pm to celebrate and continue this movement for jobs, justice, and climate action.
markey.senate.gov/news/press…

Today @RepAOC and I led dozens of our colleagues in calling on @POTUS to address the climate crisis by taking executive action on a Civilian Climate Corps for environmental justice, bold climate action, and a pathway to good-paying green union jobs. It's time.

We are going to build a just and livable future. But to do so we need a Climate Corps that puts Americans to work fighting the climate crisis while getting trained for good-paying clean jobs, all across the country. @POTUS, let’s get this done
markey.senate.gov/news/press…

Big banks are financing fossil fuels and fanning the flames of climate chaos. Climate risk is financial risk. That's why @RepPressley and I are leading our colleagues in urging @federalreserve to hold banks accountable.
Wishing a Happy New Year to all those celebrating Rosh Hashanah in Massachusetts and across the globe. L’Shanah Tovah!
markey.senate.gov/news/press…

College students who need to take voluntary medical leave for their physical & mental health face unacceptable barriers. No one should have to choose between their health and education. @SenWarren, @SenFettermanPA, and I urged @usedgov & @TheJusticeDept to stand up for students.

I’m live in Boston to address the extreme weather we’re seeing across the nation. With flooding and wildfires devastating our communities, it’s time to treat the climate crisis like what it is—an emergency. https://https://twitter.com/i/broadcasts/1YqKDgPPyYYxV

I was so lucky to speak with Grace, Taleah, Olivia, and Eva, some of the trailblazing young plaintiffs who brought the fight for a just and livable future to the Montana courts—and won. Hear their message and follow their lead.

Every year, more young people suffer under the weight of student debt as tuition skyrockets—they deserve a jumpstart. My Jumpstart on College Act will open the doors of higher ed to high school juniors & seniors, allowing them to earn college credit without the college pricetag.

Once again, this district judge has put the fate of hundreds of thousands of Dreamers in limbo. The U.S. is the only home many Dreamers have ever known. Congress must codify DACA into law. nbcnews.com/news/latino/fede…

For too long, fossil fuel companies have padded their pockets at the expense of families and frontline communities. By depending on fossil fuels we're killing our climate, poisoning our environment, and leaving Americans exposed to energy prices manipulated by global cartels.
Rally to End Fossil Fuels https://https://twitter.com/i/broadcasts/1PlKQpOMlayxE
markey.senate.gov/news/press…

As we head into today’s AI insight forum, you’re going to hear a lot about Big Tech’s ‘best and brightest’—but what they won’t tell you about are the data workers across the globe who are overworked, underpaid, and intensely surveilled. I’m demanding answers.

It’s been five years since the Columbia Gas explosions devastated Lawrence, Andover, and North Andover. The Merrimack Valley is still healing. Leonel Rondon's family is still grieving. We must pass my PIPE Act to deliver stronger protections and hold bad actors accountable.
Big Tech is here. Ready to hold them accountable.

I am heartbroken by last night’s flooding in Leominster and all across the Commonwealth. I will work with @MassGovernor, the entire Massachusetts Delegation, and our local partners to make sure everyone can recover safely and swiftly from this devastating damage.

We are facing a deadly epidemic of mass shootings and we need gun control measures that match the scale of this emergency. With Republicans in Congress blocking common-sense solutions, the Biden Admin must take further Executive Action to reduce gun violence and save lives.

Saudi Arabia and the OPEC Cartel are purposefully cutting oil production to keep gas prices high. We can’t keep letting these oil tycoons shake down American families—we need to break this dirty cycle and invest in American-made clean energy. cnbc.com/2023/09/05/saudi-ar…

22 years ago, we made a solemn promise to never forget the 3,000 lives lost on 9/11, including the more than 200 Massachusetts residents who never made it home. Today, we reflect on this tragedy, and also the bravery of the first responders who gave their lives to save others.
I’ve long envisioned a national climate bank. And now, we’ve secured $20 billion for a green future with the Greenhouse Gas Reduction Fund—making this vision a reality.bostonirish.com/around-town/…

Trans rights are human rights, and trans health care is essential. This law is horrific and bigoted. And I will not stop fighting to protect trans rights and make it easier, not harder, for trans people to access gender and life-affirming care. truthout.org/articles/judge-…
An AI arms race is nothing more than a contest of catastrophe. The U.S. must restrict military uses of AI and call on the rest of the globe to do the same. wsj.com/politics/national-se…

It’s been nearly six years since Trump’s FCC repealed #netneutrality. We can’t wait any longer. I'm proud to support Anna Gomez’s confirmation and get back to work protecting the free and open internet.

The status quo won’t fly. We need to pass my Good Jobs for Good Airports Act to show service workers the respect they deserve with livable wages and benefits for their essential work. newsweek.com/how-fix-us-air-…
If the GOP is so concerned about universal mandates—then why are Republicans trying to advance one on the floor of the Senate floor today? The Freedom to Breathe Act is a red herring. I object.

When the cell towers failed during the devastating fire in Maui, AM Radio stations remained strong. We need robust and resilient emergency communication technology to ensure Americans are receiving lifesaving information when needed the most. radioink.com/2023/09/07/as-c…
The hottest summer on record. This is a climate emergency. We need to take bold climate action that matches the scale of this crisis. We need a Green New Deal. washingtonpost.com/weather/2…

.@POTUS & @SecDebHaaland are right to cancel the illegal oil and gas leases in our Arctic Refuge, protecting this land for Arctic Indigenous people and wildlife, and taking an important step for the Western Arctic. Now let’s go further to permanently protect America's Arctic.

Thanks to Georgia's state law, the American people will rightfully have access to this trial. But the same is not true for cases in federal courts all across the country. We need the Sunshine in the Courtroom Act. cbsnews.com/news/trump-fulto…
I've taken up vlogging.

Bill Richardson fought tirelessly for not just our country—but the entire world. He was a dedicated public servant, tireless human rights defender, and a good friend. My love is with his family, friends, and the people of New Mexico as they mourn this tremendous loss.

We are facing an overdose crisis. And we need to pass my Modernizing Opioid Treatment Access Act to make sure everyone has access to the medication they need to treat opioid use disorder. medpagetoday.com/opinion/sec…

Billionaire fat cats are flying around in gas-guzzling private jets fueling the climate crisis and paying less in taxes every year. We need to pass my FATCAT Act to ground these billionaires and make the ultra-wealthy pay their fair share.
Resign.

With Hurricane Idalia bearing down, it’s clear: stronger storms and wildfires fueled by climate change pose a deadly threat. That's why @RepMaxwellFrost and I introduced the SAFE through Medicare Act—to ensure our most vulnerable have life-saving equipment in times of crisis.
Good. Making naloxone available over-the-counter in September will help save lives. But now we need to make sure it is not just available—but affordable—for everyone.
Good. Now legalize it and expunge the records.

Climate justice is health justice. We need to pass the GREEN Hospitals Act to make sure that health facilities from Springfield to San Francisco have resilient infrastructure to stand up to the climate crisis. recorder.com/Markey-legislat…

Since we passed the IRA, seniors have saved on insulin and vaccines. Now, Big Pharma will have to negotiate with Medicare on the cost of diabetes and heart failure medications for millions of Americans. We won't stop fighting until we secure truly affordable health care for all.
From our schools to our streets—we must end gun violence in America.

Communities of color have suffered for generations at the hands of gun violence, white supremacy, and hate. It has to end. We must pass stronger gun reform legislation to take weapons out of the hands of white supremacists and all who wish to do harm. Enough is enough.

Gas utilities’ disregard for safety led to death and disaster for Merrimack Valley families in 2018. I applaud @USDOT for taking steps to improve safety requirements and ensure that our pipelines aren’t ticking time bombs—because no one else should experience that devastation.

The climate crisis is here and it's affecting our health. We need to invest in a health care system that contributes to climate solutions, not climate chaos, and keeps our planet—and our people—from getting sicker. We need the Green New Deal for Health. washingtonpost.com/health/20…
It was a beautiful day to celebrate our green energy future.
Thank you, @EPAMichaelRegan.

I worked hard to make sure my National Climate Bank Act was included in the Inflation Reduction Act. And today—we celebrated. @EPA's Greenhouse Gas Reduction Fund will unleash hundreds of billions of dollars for a green, clean revolution all across our country. I can't wait.

After years of fighting for a national climate bank, I'm live in Dorchester with @EPAMichaelRegan, @MassGovernor, & @MayorWu to celebrate our new national clean financing network to fund clean projects here and across the country. https://https://twitter.com/i/broadcasts/1djxXlVwWaRxZ

I'm glad the Biden administration has heeded our calls to ensure that Massachusetts's Right to Repair Law can be enforced. Now let's keep working to make sure all car owners in our Commonwealth can take their car to whatever repair shop they choose. markey.senate.gov/news/press…
YouTube and Google may be violating COPPA by tracking and targeting kids. The FTC must investigate. theverge.com/2023/8/18/23837…

Big Oil has knowingly fueled the climate crisis and fanned the flames of devastating wildfires. And now, two years after Maui sued Big Oil and rang the alarm, we witness the destruction of Lahaina. Big Oil's greed has to stop. nytimes.com/2023/08/18/clima…
Yesterday, I joined @POTUS to celebrate the biggest climate bill in our nation’s history. Today, I’m fighting alongside the Green New Deal movement to make it the second biggest.

Mifepristone for medication abortion is still safe, and still legal. Republicans are trying to ban abortion nationwide, and they are putting the approval for all medications at risk in the process—but we won’t let them. We must codify Roe.
The clean energy revolution is here and we’re going to power it with green union jobs.
markey.senate.gov/news/press…

YouTube and Google can't keep treating young people’s data as an unprotected commodity for them to profit from. We need the FTC to investigate. And we need to pass COPPA 2.0 to finally protect young people's privacy and ban targeted advertising to kids and teens.

The @nytimes just reported that YouTube and Google might be tracking and targeting children on their platform without parental consent—violating their consent decree and my law, COPPA. This is egregious behavior and @MarshaBlackburn and I are calling on the FTC to investigate.

Thank you to the movement that got us here. And thank you to the young people showing up every day to build a just and livable future for all. For climate justice. For health justice. For racial justice. We will win.

Even as we face record-breaking heat and extreme weather disasters—I have never had more hope for our future. Because the IRA gives us proof that when we come together and we fight for what we believe in—we win. And we are going to keep fighting.

And every day since, the IRA has turned words into action to finally address the climate crisis. From the Greenhouse Gas Reduction Fund to air quality monitoring and environmental justice, this historic legislation is breaking new ground in our communities every day.
One year ago today, @POTUS signed the Inflation Reduction Act— the largest climate bill in our nation’s history—into law.

Working moms are paid just 62 cents for every dollar paid to working fathers—even though women, on average, also do twice as much unpaid labor at home. On Moms' Equal Pay Day, we demand wage and gender equality.

Every single day, Massachusetts Hospitals are stepping up to the plate to get underserved and underinsured patients the care they need. Cutting $630M in funding won't just hurt hospitals—it will hurt patients. We've called on Secretary Becerra to stop it. wbjournal.com/article/mass-h…

SCOTUS gutted affirmative action, but top colleges still give a leg up to kids of donors and alumni, who are more likely to be admitted than Black & Latino students combined. This isn’t a meritocracy—it’s classism and racism. @usedgov must end it now.

Young people are taking the fight for a just and livable future to the courts—and they are winning. Thanks to these trailblazing plaintiffs, Americans across the country can demand—and even sue—for their right to a safe, healthy, sustainable environment.
The clean energy revolution is here and we’re only getting stronger. nytimes.com/interactive/2023…

Bringing home five Americans unjustly imprisoned in Iran without releasing any taxpayer money is a major success. We must de-escalate tensions with Iran through diplomacy and continue to fight for unjustly imprisoned Americans across the globe.

As temperatures continue to shatter records, public health threats and economic costs are growing. We must protect our workers and families from rising health care costs, and equip communities with the tools to beat the heat. We need climate action now.

Families have no choice but to pay their utility bills—but utilities choose to waste ratepayer money on attacks on clean air. Utilities shouldn’t bankroll @Edison_Electric’s attempt to block @EPA from finalizing power plant standards that are good for the climate and consumers.

The climate crisis is intensifying and Big Oil is banking on it. As we suffer the effects of extreme heat and supercharged summer storms, oil hedge funds are betting on climate chaos in order to pad their pockets. reuters.com/business/energy/…
I am horrified by @GovAbbott’s implementation of this heinous, inhumane, and dangerous border barrier. The goal of these saws is clear: to inflict pain and violence. It must stop.

36 lives. An entire community. This is devastating. This is a climate emergency. I stand in solidarity with my friends and colleagues from Hawai’i—we must act fast, provide aid, and invest in a resilient and safe future.

The climate crisis has arrived at the gate. While fat cats in their private jets pay pennies on the dollar to add fuel to this emergency, the rest of us are left shouldering the burden of climate chaos. The one percent can’t get out of paying the price of their polluting.
markey.senate.gov/news/press…

Today I’m celebrating more than $14 million in federal funding for Massachusetts’s regional and public airports. Our airports connect communities to the rest of New England—and the country. With new taxiways and runways, this funding will serve generations of travelers to come.
markey.senate.gov/news/press…

Unwanted robocalls violate consumers’ consent—and waste their time. We have the regulations in place to keep telemarketers in check. It’s time to enforce them. That’s why @SenatorLujan and I are urging the @FCC to enforce its rules to eliminate unwanted robocalls calls.

We passed the IRA and spurred clean energy construction all across the country. Now we need to make sure that the workers on these projects get paid a fair wage. I am so glad that the Biden administration is taking action to give workers the raise that they deserve.

Newly arriving immigrants are facing long delays before they can legally work. It's unacceptable. The Biden Admin must expedite the work permit process so that everyone has access to the income and housing they need to not just survive, but thrive. bostonglobe.com/2023/08/08/m…
This isn't 1984. We need a ban on government use of facial recognition and biometric technologies now. rawstory.com/after-black-pre…
The hottest June ever recorded. The hottest July ever recorded. And now it's expected to be Earth's hottest year yet. We need a Green New Deal. washingtonpost.com/climate-e…

I was proud to join my colleagues in Lowell today to celebrate $21.4 million in federal funding for the Mill City bridges. Thanks to the RAISE grant program, Lowell and cities across the nation have the resources they need to build a bridge to a stronger, more resilient future.
A year ago today we passed the Inflation Reduction Act in the Senate. Thank you to the movement that got us here. Now let’s keep fighting and make it the second largest climate bill ever passed.

Unacceptable. Facial recognition frequently misidentifies vulnerable and marginalized people. We need to pass my bill to prohibit the use of biometric technologies by federal entities and law enforcement so that people like Porcha aren't wrongly accused. nytimes.com/2023/08/06/busin…

Join us live in Lowell as we celebrate $21.4 million in federal funding for the Mill City’s Bridges. From the Merrimack, Lower Pawtucket, and West Canals to the River Meadow Brook—we need safe bridges for generations to come. https://https://twitter.com/i/broadcasts/1lDxLnlDmnwGm

Good. Expanded telehealth services during the public health emergency made it easier to access essential care. I’m glad DEA is considering keeping these flexibilities in place, especially for medications for opioid use disorder. This can save lives.

250 years ago, early revolutionaries planned the Boston Tea Party at the Old South Meeting House. Today, we’re celebrating $480,000 in federal funds to preserve this important piece of our nation’s history. boston.com/news/local-news/2….

I was proud to join @EPA and the Three Rivers Watershed in Cambridge as they issue their report card for the health of our waterways. Clean, safe and resilient waterways is a matter of environmental justice. We will keep working together to clean up our rivers.
I’m live at the EPA and Three Rivers Watershed’s Annual Report Card event in Cambridge. https://https://twitter.com/i/broadcasts/1kvJpmvoaowxE

This summer’s flooding has caused severe damage to homes and businesses across Western Massachusetts. Today I visited construction in Deerfield, where rainfall brought 11 ft of flooding. This devastation makes it clear—our communities are shouldering the effects of climate chaos.

While speaking with farm owners in the Pioneer Valley today, I was devastated to learn the extent to which extreme flooding has impacted their livelihoods. At Natural Roots Farm in Conway, flooding wiped out 95% of crops. To support our communities, we need climate action now.

Today I was proud to visit the Baystate Medical Center in Springfield to introduce my GREEN Hospitals Act. Climate chaos is making people sick—we need bold action to end our dual public health and climate crises.

Our utilities should be prioritizing people, public health, and affordable renewable power—not their ability to pollute for profit.  Utilities with clean power commitments shouldn’t undercut their own targets by supporting attacks on the EPA’s strong power plant standards.
Senator Markey Live in Springfield https://https://twitter.com/i/broadcasts/1kvJpmvXLQoxE
I look forward to our continued partnership as we fight to secure their sovereignty and build a just and livable future for all.

From learning about tribal history with Mother Bear, to hearing about the First Light Oyster Farm’s important work to cultivate shellfish, exercise their aboriginal rights, and clean Popponesset Bay—I had a wonderful time meeting with members of the Mashpee Wampanoag Tribe today.
I had a great time today at @NOAA in Woods Hole learning all about their continued work to protect not just our oceans—but our entire planet—from climate change.

Massachusetts welcomes immigrants. That’s why @SenWarren and I are calling on the Biden admin to expedite work permit processing and remove unnecessary obstacles so that new arrivals aren’t stuck in limbo for months with no source of income or housing. bostonglobe.com/2023/08/01/n…
Still thinking about all the magnificent sea turtles we sent back to their home in Nantucket Sound.

I’m pleased to introduce Orzo. A rehabilitated sea turtle who we released today at West Dennis beach alongside 7 of his cousins. Thank you @NEAQ for the months of care you give to Orzo and hundreds of others. Let’s keep working together to keep sea turtles safe.
I had such a great time at @A_WhiteShark today learning about these magnificent creatures who we are so lucky to co-exist with.

A fantastic crowd today at the 2023 OneCape Summit. From climate action to infrastructure, the leaders at today's summit are turning words into action to create a brighter, more livable future on Cape Cod.

Big Oil has known for decades that they are fueling the climate crisis and lied to hide it. Now, we’re seeing record-breaking temperatures and unprecedented damage. We must hold them accountable for their misleading, unforgivable campaigning.

I am grateful for the time I spent at the @NAACP national convention this weekend—an opportunity to recommit to the fight for racial justice in America. And a chance to celebrate Boston’s—and the nation’s—history-making Black leaders who I’m so proud to celebrate and support.
It was an honor to welcome @VP to Boston as she arrived for the 114th @NAACP national convention. I am grateful for your leadership as we fight for true racial, social, and economic justice for all.

Today I joined @PatriciaFabianS, @GreenRoots, and @GarciaJudithMA in Chelsea to introduce my Preventing HEAT Illness & Deaths Act. We need bold action now to lower these record-breaking temperatures, but we must also protect communities from the health effects of extreme heat.

I’m live in Chelsea to announce my Preventing HEAT Illness & Deaths Act. This summer’s sweltering heat isn’t just shattering records—it’s shattering any illusion that the climate crisis hasn’t already arrived. https://https://twitter.com/i/broadcasts/1jMKgLmAvZPGL

Even in the wake of COVID-19, our public health system isn’t prepared for the next crisis. I’m introducing my Public Health Nursing Act to strengthen our health care system so that it’s ready to protect the public—and that starts with the workers who make this system run: nurses.

These back-to-back days of record-breaking heat are no coincidence—the climate crisis is at our doorstep. We need urgent action to combat this deadly heat. That’s why I’m reintroducing my Preventing HEAT Illness & Deaths Act to protect Americans from heat-related illness.

While I am grateful that the NDAA passed tonight includes my language to compel the DOD to take the overdose crisis among service members and their families seriously, I can’t support a package that inflates military spending at the expense of working and middle-class families.
Real security means facing the climate crisis head-on by forging a clean energy future here at home and weakening the grip of fossil-fueled despots and their regimes overseas.
Real security means placing guardrails on Big Tech and emerging technologies so they can never be exploited by bad actors or fuel a youth mental health crisis.

This bloated budget does not advance our national security. Real security means investing in our communities at a time when hospital closures are at record highs and the opioid epidemic is reaching every corner of our country.

The American people have repeatedly heard from Republicans that we need to cut government spending—for education, for health care, for food assistance—and now they are enthusiastically throwing funding to their defense contractor friends.
Tonight, the Senate voted to pad the Pentagon with a near trillion-dollar spending package to the tune of $886 billion. Ridiculous.

Black women had to work an extra 208 days to earn the same amount that white men did in 2022—making just 67 cents to the dollar. On Black Women's Equal Pay Day, we recommit to closing the racial and gender wage gaps, securing equal pay, and ending this injustice.
markey.senate.gov/news/press…

Immigrant families are an essential part of our nation. We need to make sure every New American can thrive. That's why I'm reintroducing my National Office for New Americans Act to give new immigrants and refugees tools to engage in our economy and civic life.

Our transportation future must be electric and zero-emission, including our trains. The climate crisis is here, and yet industries like railroads are holding onto record-breaking profits instead of breaking their dependence on fossil fuels. We need higher standards.
@SenTedCruz and I will keep fighting to pass the AM Radio for Every Vehicle Act and make sure AM radio stays in vehicles across the nation.

I am also celebrating the successful passage of my legislation to save AM Radio – an essential communication tool during emergencies and an essential source of news, entertainment, sports, and music for tens of millions of drivers.

My COPPA 2.0 is key to addressing our nation’s youth mental health crisis, which is fueled by an online privacy crisis. I’m proud to work alongside @SenBillCassidy to meet our moral obligation to deliver for the young people, parents, and physicians demanding change.

I am proud that my COPPA 2.0 legislation to reign in Big Tech and protect young people’s privacy online just advanced unopposed through the Commerce Committee. We are one step closer to stopping Big Tech from tracking, targeting and traumatizing young people online.

Congratulations to @sunrisemvmtdtx and the young people in Dallas who organized for free public transit and won. The climate movement is strong. And it’s victories like yours that make me sure—we will keep fighting for free public transit all across the country and we will win.

More than 40 lives have been taken by wildfires raging across Algeria, Italy, and Greece. These wildfires are driven by an extreme heatwave that scientists have called "virtually impossible" if it weren't for climate change. We need action.
bbc.com/news/world-europe-66…
On this day and every day, we must listen to the disability community, fight alongside the disability community, and work together to build a truly accessible future for all of us.
And it’s why I will not waver in protecting the rights of qualified jurors against ableism and ageism in our federal courts through my Disability and Age in Jury Service Nondiscrimination Act.
Why I won’t stop demanding that the @CDC do better to support long COVID patients, and protect disabled, immunocompromised, and elderly Americans from COVID-19.

It’s why I’ll keep fighting to pass my Student Mental Health Rights Act, to demand that the federal government protect the rights of students with mental health disabilities on their college campuses.

We know that there is more work to do—and that the fight for accessibility must persist as our world changes. That’s why I was proud to reintroduce my CVTA Act yesterday to ensure that everyone can access the technological advancements of today and tomorrow.

Congress must pass my Facial Recognition and Biometric Technology Moratorium Act and stop the dangerous proliferation of this technology.

It's clear—biometric tools pose a very tangible, personal threat to our civil liberties. They are making it increasingly difficult for us to move, appear, and congregate in public without being tracked.
In 2022, Alonzo Sawyer, a Black man from Maryland, was falsely identified and arrested for assaulting a bus driver and stealing her phone. He spent nine days in prison.

In 2019, Nijeer Parks spent 10 days in jail after law enforcement’s facial recognition software had falsely identified him as a man who shoplifted candy and attempted to hit a police officer with his car.
Companies like Clearview are reportedly allowing more than 1,000 law enforcement agencies to upload photos of unidentified faces and scan the internet for images matching their likeness.

Last I checked, 1984 was a work of fiction. But right now many government agencies are using facial rec, and false arrests of Black men have continued—ripping innocent people away from their families and locking them in jail. It's unacceptable.
